title: Uninstall OO Workflow Designer
content:
Before uninstalling OO Workflow Designer, ensure that you back up the current version.

There are two ways to uninstall OO Workflow Designer:

  • Using the uninstall wizard on both Windows and Linux
  • Silent uninstall on both Windows and Linux

Uninstall OO Workflow Designer using the wizard

Uninstall OO Workflow Designer on Windows

  1. Navigate to the installation directory, for example, C:\Program Files\Micro Focus\Operations Orchestration Designer for Windows.

  2. Right click uninstall.exe and run as an administrator, and then click Next.

  3. Select the OO Workflow Designer, and then click Next.

  4. When prompted to continue, click Yes. The Uninstall Progress screen displays the progress of the uninstall process and the items that were deleted or removed.

Uninstall OO Workflow Designer on Linux

  1. Navigate to the installation directory, for example, /opt/microfocus/oo-designer/ for Linux.

  2. Open a Terminal window.

  3. Type the following command at the prompt and press Enter.

export DISPLAY=<ip address> 
./uninstall

Uninstall OO Workflow Designer using the silent option

A silent uninstallation is one that's started from the command line and completes without any input from the person who started it. You can silently uninstall the components from either Windows or Linux.

To perform silent uninstallation of OO Workflow Designer, navigate to the installation directory, open a command line/Terminal window, and type the following:Â uninstall -s <components>. In the <components> placeholder, enter designer.

For example: uninstall -s designer for Windows or ./uninstall -s designer for Linux.

Tip: After the uninstallation is complete, you should delete the installation directory.
